data.title: Mordecai Roshwald (1921-2015)
data.meta_description: At the National Library of Israel, you can find information on Mordecai Roshwald (1921-2015) and view a variety of items related to the topic such as manuscripts, books, archives, photographs and more. Read more at:

When the Nazis Stole Lea Goldberg’s Doctoral Thesis

Many of us know Lea Goldberg primarily as a poet and children’s author. But she was also a playwright, painter, editor, translator, teacher, and literary scholar. She produced a myriad of classic Hebrew poems and stories, many of which remain present and popular in Israeli culture to this day. I

To the article on our blog

Feldenkrais: The Man Who Stood Ben-Gurion on His Head

There was one man who was able to tell David Ben-Gurion what to do. He even told him to stand on his head, and Ben-Gurion obeyed. His name was Moshe Feldenkrais, a gifted teacher of movement who accumulated many students and patients, one of which was Israel’s first Prime Minister. When asked how o

World War II

World War II was the most destructive and deadly war in human history. The war officially began when Nazi Germany invaded Poland on September 1, 1939.
